channel.title: Comments on: Idea: Cellphone Call-Again-If-Urgent Mode
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
Thanks... actually, I tried looking at Android APIs but couldn't find a way to hook into the incoming call notification the way I wanted to. But that was a long time ago and I didn't ask the people in the forums, who would have probably provided the answer. I might give it another shot sometime soon.
Another thing is that Google is now opening Google Voice, which consolidates all your phones. It can probably implement a feature like this as well.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks… actually, I tried looking at Android APIs but couldn’t find a way to hook into the incoming call notification the way I wanted to. But that was a long time ago and I didn’t ask the people in the forums, who would have probably provided the answer. I might give it another shot sometime soon.

Another thing is that Google is now opening Google Voice, which consolidates all your phones. It can probably implement a feature like this as well.

item.title: By: kila
item.dc:creator: kila
item.description: Android opened their app store to charge money for apps.
item.content:encoded: Android opened their app store to charge money for apps.

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: Thanks. Maybe I can submit it to the Android Developer Challenge: http://code.google.com/android/adc.html The winners will probably be "cool" applications, but it'll be nice to participate
item.content:encoded:
Thanks.
Maybe I can submit it to the Android Developer Challenge:
http://code.google.com/android/adc.html
The winners will probably be “cool” applications, but it’ll be nice to participate

item.title: By: rom
item.dc:creator: rom
item.description: Great idea, maybe you should consider android (or even better, j2me - because my phone supports it) implementation :)
item.content:encoded: Great idea, maybe you should consider android (or even better, j2me – because my phone supports it) implementation :)
